New Records: Jonatan Clase hit his first career home run.
Key Match Events: Jonatan Clase went 3 for 3 with a walk, scored twice, and drove in two runs.
Kevin Gausman pitched six innings, allowing one run and four hits, and matched his career high in wins.
Alejandro Kirk extended his career-best hitting streak to 17 games with three hits and three RBIs.
Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit consecutive doubles and finished 2 for 4 with 197 hits this season.
Richard Fitts extended his scoreless streak to 18 2/3 innings before allowing four runs and six hits in five innings.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager John Schneider praised Jonatan Clase's performance.
Kevin Gausman expressed satisfaction with tying his career high in wins but wished for better performance.
Red Sox manager Alex Cora reflected on the missed playoff opportunity and the team's poor second half.
Jarren Duran expressed pride in the team's accomplishments and viewed it as a building block for next year.
Richard Fitts felt he let the team down in a crucial game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Blue Jays eliminated the Red Sox from postseason contention.
The Blue Jays finished 21-31 against AL East opponents for the second straight year.
The Red Sox missed the playoffs for the third straight season, the first time since 2010-2012.
The Red Sox finished their road schedule at 43-38 and are 37-41 at Fenway Park with three games remaining.
Others: Toronto recalled RHP Brett de Geus from Triple-A Buffalo and optioned RHP Tommy Nance to the spring training facility.
Blue Jays SS Bo Bichette was scheduled to have surgery on his fractured right middle finger.
The Blue Jays will close out the season by hosting Miami in a three-game series starting Friday.
The Red Sox will return home to wrap up their season with a three-game series against Tampa Bay starting Friday.
